page.title: 18TRADE
page.content: THE ROMAN N.S.E.W. STREET PLAN STILL KEEPS OUR MARKET AND SHOPPING CENTRE AROUND THE MAIN CROSS ROADS CAUSING PROBLEMS. FIRST SHOPPERS WITHIN A RADIUS OF 1KM. WALK TO STORES OR SUPERMARKETS WHOSE PRICES SRE LOWER AND CARRY HEAVY BAGS WHICH IS TIRING. SECONDLY THE MORE DISTANT CAR SHOPPERS FIND PARKING CARS DIFFICULT,MULTISTOREY AND ROOFTOP CAR PARKS FILL QUICKLY AS DO SIDE STREETS LIMITED TO 1 HOUR PARKING. THURSDAYS AND SATURDAYS ARE PEAK SHOPPING TIMES AND PAVEMENTS ARE CROWDED. SOME STORES LOAN OUT METAL TROLLEYS FOR TRANSPORTING GOODS TO CARS AT THEIR CAR PARKS. TRAFFIC FLOW IS RESTRICTED AT THE CROSS AND AN INNER RELEIF ROAD REMAINS UNFINISHED. KING'S SQUARE IS FOR PEDE3STRIANS ONLY. SEVERAL SUPERMARKETS HAVE MOVED TO THE SUBURBS ACCESS BEING EASIER FOR CUSTOMERS.
